evidence: We presented a two stage approach to model nonlocal dependencies and saw that it outperformed existing approaches to modeling non-local dependencies .
text: We presented a two stage approach to model nonlocal dependencies and saw that it outperformed existing approaches to modeling non-local dependencies .

evidence: Our approach also makes it easy to incorporate non-local information from other documents in the test corpus , and this gives us a 13.3 percent error reduction over NER systems using local-information alone .
text: Our approach also makes it easy to incorporate non-local information from other documents in the test corpus , and this gives us a 13.3 percent error reduction over NER systems using local-information alone .

evidence: Using features capturing non-local dependencies from the same document , our approach yields a 12.6 percent relative error reduction on the F1 score , over state-of-theart NER systems using local-information alone , when compared to the 9.3 percent relative error reduction offered by the best systems that exploit non-local information .
text: Using features capturing non-local dependencies from the same document , our approach yields a 12.6 percent relative error reduction on the F1 score , over state-of-theart NER systems using local-information alone , when compared to the 9.3 percent relative error reduction offered by the best systems that exploit non-local information .

evidence: Our approach also made it easy to exploit various dependencies across documents in the test corpus , whereas incorporating this information in most existing approaches would make them intractable due to the complexity of the resultant graphical model .
text: Our approach also made it easy to exploit various dependencies across documents in the test corpus , whereas incorporating this information in most existing approaches would make them intractable due to the complexity of the resultant graphical model .
